headline: Does Brown‑Forman’s (BF.B) Ultra‑Premium King of Kentucky Release Clarify Its Premiumization Playbook?
summary: In early February 2026, Brown-Forman’s King of Kentucky brand marked the United States’ 250th anniversary with a limited-edition three-batch Small Batch release, featuring 12–18-year-old bourbon bottled at 105, 107.5, and 110 proof with markedly high angel’s share evaporation. The distinct proofs and barrel selection for each batch highlight Brown-Forman’s focus on premium, scarcity-driven offerings that can reinforce brand prestige in high-end whiskey. Now, we’ll examine how this...
